generateUUID

public static java.lang.String generateUUID(java.lang.String prefix)
Attempts to generate a fairly universally unique identifier of the form: 
    <uuid_call_num>:<time>:<host>.
Where: <uuid_call_num> is the number of times this UUID routine has been called.

<time> is the current time in milliseconds.

<host> is the internet address of the host machine. If not available, the user name and user home are used.

Note that this UUID is not truely unique, since two processes on the same machine could generate the same numbered UUID.

This method is thread-safe--several coexisting threads can call it and be guaranteed a unique UUID.

A sample UUID is: 10:973202057660:64.92.27.47 if no host machine name is available, the form is 7:973202057660:mikeC:\WINDOWS.

notNull

public static void notNull(java.lang.Object obj,
                           java.lang.String arg)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Ensures that obj is non-null. If found to be null, this method and raises an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
obj - the Object to ensure is non-null.
arg - the name of the argument being checked--used for issuing an error message and throwing an exception with a message of the form: 
   "Found the object '" + arg + "' to be null."
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if obj is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getAbrevClassName

public static java.lang.String getAbrevClassName(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the class name of an object without all the package information This is very useful for debugging (e.g., toString()) routines.

Parameters:
obj - the Object from which to derive the class name. Example: 
getClassName ("package.CachingList")-->"CachingList"
Returns:
the String representing the class name, or null if obj is null.

copyList

public static java.util.List copyList(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> to_copy)
Return a copy of a given List. Currently, an ArrayList-based implementation is used for the copy.

Parameters:
to_copy - the List to copy.
Returns:
a shallow copy of to_copy. If to_copy is null, return null.

stringEqual

public static boolean stringEqual(java.lang.String field1,
                                  java.lang.String field2,
                                  boolean case_sensitive)
Check if two string fields are equal to each other.

Parameters:
field1 - first string to compare. May be null.
field2 - second string to compare. May be null.
case_sensitive - true if we are to match in a case sensitive manner, false otherwise.
Returns:
true if the two fields are null or have the same characters. Return false otherwise.

getSuffix

public static java.lang.String getSuffix(java.lang.String str,
                                         char match_char)
Return the part of a string to the right of a match character (i.e., suffix).

Parameters:
str - the String within which to search for a suffix. May be null.
match_char - the character to match for finding a suffix. all characters to the right of the rightmost match_char make up the suffix.
Returns:
null if no match character is found or if the match character is at the end of the string, or if str is null. Otherwise the String suffix is returned.

ensurePathCreated

public static boolean ensurePathCreated(java.lang.String dir_path)
Ensures that a specified directory exists.

Parameters:
dir_path - the path to a given directory. If dir_path doesn't exist, it is created.
Returns:
true if the directory already exists, or is successfully created. Returns false otherwise.

public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object obj)
